title: pytorch build from source with CUDA 9 and CUDNN 7
body_html:
If I want to build PyTorch from source with CUDA9 and CUDNN 7, is that right to simply change "magma-cuda80" to "magma-cuda90" then follow the instructions in README?

Just like this:

export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$(dirname $(which conda))/../"
conda install numpy pyyaml mkl setuptools cmake cffi
conda install -c soumith magma-cuda90
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
python setup.py install

Really thanks!
@soumith
